content: Draft a poem about clouds with exactly 55 words.

Clouds, so free, in sky they roam,
Shapes and sizes, never the same.
White and puffy, or dark and gloom,
They paint the heavens, a constant game.

Sometimes like cotton, soft and light,
Other times like mountains, standing tall.
They bring rain, they bring sunshine,
In their mystery, we all stand small.

Yet, in their transient beauty,
We find solace, peace, and wonder.
Clouds, eternal wanderers,
In their dance, our spirits ponder.
